data.title: My Retained List and Additions
data.meta_description: Goalkeepers -   Mildenhall will definitely be on his way out as he is keen on taking up a coaching role (not sure whether that is at Rovers or elsewhere). Keep Will Puddy as he is still fairly y
data.text:
Post by Saint on

Goalkeepers -

Mildenhall will definitely be on his way out as he is keen on taking up a coaching role (not sure whether that is at Rovers or elsewhere). Keep Will Puddy as he is still fairly young and has showed great promise in the conference. Bring in Sam Russell who was released from FGR.

Defenders -

Make Leadbitter first choice RB with Lockyer as back up. Parkes and McChrystal the first choice CB pair with Lockyer also fighting for a spot there. Lee Brown to stay first choice LB. Possible back up needed at LB but not essential, Trotman to stay as he has Football League pedigree.

Midfielders -

Retain Lines at all costs and keep him in the centre with Mansell. Sinclair to fight for his place in CM or possibility play wide right. Monkhouse on the left. Keep Balanta, Ollie Clarke and Jake Gosling. Sign Nathan Arnold who has recently been released from his parent club after being on loan at Grimsby.

See Arnold play-off goals here:

Strikers -

Main strikers to be Matty Taylor, Ellis Harrison and Jermaine Easter, with Lenell John-Lewis to sign from Grimsby to sign on a permanent deal. I would like to see Blissett stay and get his chance in League 2, but maybe he wouldn't quite do it, so possibly loan him out to another League 2 club or top conference team. Ellis Harrison must be kept. Although, I can really see a championship side like Birmingham coming in for him.

Transfer Targets (List):

Sam Russell (Free Agent - ex FGR)

Chris Lines (Port Vale)

Nathan Arnold (Free Agent - was on loan at Grimsby)

Lenell John-Lewis (Grimsby)

Post by kingswood Polak on

Midfielders -

Retain Lines at all costs and keep him in the centre with Mansell. Sinclair to fight for his place in CM or possibility play wide right. Monkhouse on the left. Let go of Balanta, keep Ollie Clarke and Jake Gosling. Sign Nathan Arnold who has recently been released from his parent club after being on loan at Grimsby.

Strikers -

Main strikers to be Matty Taylor, Ellis Harrison and Jermaine Easter, with Lenell John-Lewis to sign from Grimsby to sign on a permanent deal. I would like to see Blissett stay and get his chance in League 2, but maybe he wouldn't quite do it, so possibly loan him out to another League 2 club or top conference team. Would love to see him stay though. Ellis Harrison must be kept. Although, I really can see a championship side coming in for him.

Transfer Targets (List):

Sam Russell (Free Agent - ex FGR)

Chris Lines (Port Vale)

Nathan Arnold (Free Agent - was on loan at Grimsby)

Lenell John-Lewis (Grimsby)

As I understand it, we may not be able to hold onto Parkes but I hope we do

Indeed ,I think Mr parkes could be heading up the M5!

Post by Westcountry Gas on

I don't think anyone should be released apart from Balanta & possibly Blissett on a 6 month loan to somewhere like Torquay or Aldershot, but in DC's opinion he may like Balanta and want to keep him. We need a slightly bigger squad with the 7 sub rule & the extra cup games, but i still think we need to remember that the key is leaving enough budget for quality loan signings something we will definitely do better in now we are back in the football league, where players are happy to join & clubs happy to loan to. 3 Permanent signings needed IMO, centre midfield (Lines), 2 x Right footed wingers one a marquee signing and the other a young lad with a decent pedigree.

Post by Saint on

Why the Grimsby front men love in - hardly hurt us at all in 3 matches!

Very keen to retain the main spine of Sunday's XI.

New keeper, cover at CH, 2 widemen, striker and possibly central midfielder.

Probably release Mildenhall, Trotman & Balanta. Clark & Gosling depending on their wages might keep as cover. Sinclair keep if his injury is sorted. Send Blissett on loan to a good Conference side to continue his education.

Sign Lines now!

From what I can remember, LJL was excellent in the home game v Grimsby and caused problems on Sunday, scoring a goal inside 3 minutes. I've also seen Grimsby at least 5 times this season and Arnold has been a real threat.

Puddy

Leadbitter

Parkes

Macca

Brown

Arnold

Lines

Mansell

Monkhouse

Harrison

Taylor

Bench:

Russell

Lockyer

Sinclair

Easter

LJL

.. Would be very happy if this is how we lined up for the first game of the season.
